Traffic congestion would decrease significantly as bicycles require less space and can move more easily through traffic. This would lead to a reduction in air pollution and noise pollution as well.
People would become more physically active as they would have to rely on cycling for transportation, leading to a healthier population.
The demand for gasoline and oil would decrease, leading to a reduction in the prices of these resources.
Cities would become more bike-friendly, with more bike lanes, bike parking, and bike-sharing programs. This would encourage more people to cycle, leading to a reduction in car ownership.

The transportation industry would undergo a major shift, with more people relying on bicycles for transportation. This would lead to the development of new technologies and innovations related to bicycle transportation, such as electric bicycles and self-driving bicycles.
